title: The Essential Guide to Self-Sufficiency: Cultivating Your Survival Garden"**

subtasks: Identify mature leaves on plants
Use scissors/shears to cut leaves at the base
Collect cut leaves, discard or compost damaged ones
Leave a few leaves on each plant to promote regrowth
Inspect plants for yellow or diseased leaves to remove
Clean harvested leaves in vinegar solution to disinfect
Store cleaned green vegetables for later use (e.g., freezing)
Cover plants to protect from severe weather
Assess plant survival and recovery after storm
Maintain proper plant spacing for accessibility
Practice crop rotation or companion planting (not directly shown, but implied for complete farm cycle)
Regularly trim outer leaves of plants for continuous harvesting
Save seeds or propagate new plants as needed
Use harvested greens for consumption or preservation
